summary: Jon: What’s the four-letters word for “perfect”? Arya: Dunno. What? Jon: Arya. Arya *blushing* Aw
body:

Arya: Dunno. What?
Jon: Arya.
Arya *blushing* Aw

blog.description: Semi-obsessed with building a Game of Thrones world and finding/making clothing for Daenerys. Why am I so interested in the Sims 4? Why do I care? No idea, but here are some of my efforts! I will post some S4CC, but full credit to any original creators!

body:
Seven Save Us…

Shout out to @laboratorioautoral for being such a huge contributor to the Jonrya fanfiction community!

*********************************************

Robb’s name day was always a fun event.

The children would usually gather around to celebrate it come dinner time, Cat allowed them to have all the sweets they want and to give their brother his gifts.

Their full brother.

His name day was usually celebrated in private, with little gifts exchanged in secret (as if she didn’t already know, but Catelyn let them be, it wouldn’t do to turn him against his half-siblings). A suitable reminder that he was not on equal footing with her trueborn son.

On their ten and two name day though, Robb had decided that all the children should throw a tourney. And in the span of two hours the practice yard turned into a grand tourney ground, with blankets and sheets and chairs snuck from the castle gracing it’s stands. Usually this kind of thing would never pass but seeing how keen Robb was on proving himself a man grown, she decided to make an exception just this once.

There she sat watching with a smile on her face as the boys sparred, Ned by her side holding her hand. His back straight and his chin held high as any proud father would be. Soon the girls began to gather around the yard to attend the tourney, and a soft laugh made its way out of her when she saw how they were throwing their favors at her boy.

Robb won once. Twice. Thrice. All against Jon Snow.

What a lovely day it was!

It wasn’t until Arya ran into the ring, shrieking with delight and waving her practice sword like a true terror that her smile died down. Cat let go of Ned’s hand, running towards her pup before she got hurt.

‘Arya Stark’ In an instant she was upon her ‘what do you think you’re doing?’

‘I’m having fun with them’ she looked at her with all the innocence of a seven year old ‘I have a sword and I’ll go get a shield too!’

‘Hand me the sword now Arya!’ She held out her hand at her little girl, but her daughter only hugged it close like a doll.

Sighing, Cat crouched in front of her, careful not to get her dress too dirty ‘look around you Arya, everyone is quiet’ she bade her to understand ‘the fun had to stop because no one wants you to get hurt, you are a young lady my love, a precious thing that should be kept unharmed. Now give me the sword and sit with your sister.’

Arya’s lower lip trembled as watched the way everyone stood still and stared at them, with a dejected nod she waddled out of the practice yard and into her place at the stands, Arya never gave Cat the sword. But if hugging her toy would calm her down then she’ll let her have it.

She’ll understand when she’s older why I did this, she’ll know it was for her own good

Cat made her way back to a weary looking Ned, painfully aware of the way Arya seemed to fold in on herself. At least now she was next to her sister, and hopefully Sansa will find a way to lift her mood like she always did with Lysa. The girls around her were already laughing after all.

When she looked back at that day Cat couldn’t imagine how she had missed the fire that burned in the bastard’s eyes at that moment.

The tourney started again and Robb won, but so did Jon Snow. So much so in fact that he somehow made up for his loss all the way to the final match, again between him and her boy.

It did not take him five minutes to knock her husband’s heir to the ground.

The bastard faked his loss before. She realized as her blood froze in her veins.

She watched as he held out his hand to Robb, helping him up.

She watched him as he marched to little Bran, gently plucking the crown of winter roses from his hands.

She watched him as he marched to Sansa, bypassing all the girls that threw their handkerchiefs at him.

She watched as he ignored her eldest, and placed the crown of frosted flowers on her youngest’s head. She watched as her girl jumped at him over stands, his arms catching her and twirling her around with ease as Arya giggled like a maid in love. Something about the scene suddenly made her uncomfortable.

In her hand, Ned’s own trembled. Cat turned to face him and was shocked to see what she found, his face looked tired and miserable and scared. Not even in his own subtle way, but it was clear to see for all.

Cat looked back at the scene, and then back at Ned. Her head going back and forth as if she was watching a snow fight. Something in her mind clicking but not quite clicking.

The Tourney, the sword in Arya’s hand, the fire, Sansa’s disappointment, the crown of winter roses.

Oh no.

Her stomach fell as she realized that she was absolutely going to murder whoever put this thing together. Of course Ned would be like that, his own sister was taken by prince Rhaegar right after he crowned her like that and then…

And then…

He had to go save her.

He came back with the boy.

The Tourney, the sword in Arya’s hand, the fire, Sansa’s disappointment, the crown of winter roses.

And then…

Did he? Then it would make sense that he wouldn’t tell her. If information like that was to ever get out…

Her eyes flickered back to Ned’s heartbroken face, his hands clenching hers now…

Oh no!

Seven save us…

summary: Friendly reminder after Ned's death, Arya wanted the river to sweep out King's Landing, all its people, but then she thought...
body: Friendly reminder after Ned’s death, Arya wanted the river to sweep out King’s Landing, all its people, but then she thought that Sansa was still there and so she did not want this to happen. Remember the next time you’ll say that Arya hates her sister

reblog.comment: Friendly reminder after Ned’s death, Arya wanted the river to sweep out King’s Landing, all its people, but then she thought that Sansa was still there and so she did not want this to happen. Remember the next time you’ll say that Arya hates her sister

tags: didn't get to post this weekend
title: Sunday Six
body: Could it have really happened? Were her dreams true? Arya was restless and miserable the whole morning, hoping that it all had been just a figment of her imagination. That Nymeria was still running in the woods, far away from trouble. Yet she couldn’t stop worrying. She snapped at the man who wanted more sausage for his breakfast and talked back to Mistress Alwen over a simple matter of a burned bread, and once the caravan was on the road again, she walked alone, apart from the others, stewing in her temper.

reblog.comment: Could it have really happened? Were her dreams true? Arya was restless and miserable the whole morning, hoping that it all had been just a figment of her imagination. She snapped at the man who wanted more sausage for his breakfast and talked back to Mistress Alwen over a simple matter of a burned bread, and once the caravan was on the road again, she walked alone, apart from the others, stewing in her temper.

blog.name: furious-winter
blog.title: frigid furiosity
blog.description: "There are no men like me. Only me."

summary:
Gendry: Rough childhood?
Arya: Rougher than yours. My father was killed. 
Gendry: Huh. Never even knew my father. 
Arya: Ever...
body:
Gendry: Rough childhood?
Arya: Rougher than yours. My father was killed. 
Gendry: Huh. Never even knew my father. 
Arya: Ever had a cigarette put out on your skin?
Gendry: Where else do you put one out?
Arya: I watched my own birthday party through the keyhole of a locked closet in Braavos, which also happened to be-
Gendry: Your bedroom. Lucky. I slept in a dishwasher box. 
Arya: *gasps* You had a dishwasher? I didn't even know sleep. It was pretty much 24/7 ball gags, brownie mix, and Faith Militant porn. 
Gendry: *laughs* Who would do such a thing?
Arya: Hopefully, you.

tags: we were the kings and the queues
summary:
I just saw a (possibly) unconfirmed rumour about GOT's new season. 
Sansa and Arya are condeming Tyrion to death for treason....
body:
I just saw a (possibly) unconfirmed rumour about GOT’s new season.
Sansa and Arya are condeming Tyrion to death for treason.
And I am here like…. the Lannisters and the Starks were never allies to begin with. Or did the writers forget that too?

reblog.comment:

summary: I made it a little too big, but not bad for my first iron-on vinyl project 👍 It's hard to get a picture while he's on the move,...
body:
I made it a little too big, but not bad for my first iron-on vinyl project 👍 It’s hard to get a picture while he’s on the move, but it says “A Boy Is Three.”

Happy almost-birthday to my boy, who is definitely not No One 🖤

reblog.comment:
I made it a little too big, but not bad for my first iron-on vinyl project 👍 It’s hard to get a picture while he’s on the move, but it says “A Boy Is Three.”

Happy almost-birthday to my boy, who is definitely not No One 🖤

blog.name: incorrect-got-quotes
blog.title: Dead, almost like my interest in the show
blog.description: I post quotes when I feel like it. Mostly nowadays I don’t.If you want to use one of the quotes as a story or drawing prompt, I'm fine with that, as long as you credit me in your story or art. Also, tag any drawings under #oberyn’s saucy art. Yes, I am in fact Oberyn Martell. For those on mobile, here is my ship list: https://incorrect-got-quotes.tumblr.com/list-of-ships Main: garnetislovegarnetislife. SUBMISSION BOX IS (MOST LIKELY) PERMANENTLY CLOSED!

summary: 🐺 Arya Stark appreciation 33/-  She wondered whether she would find a godswood in Braavos, with a weirwood at its heart. Denyo...
caption:
🐺 Arya Stark appreciation 33/-

She wondered whether she would find a godswood in Braavos, with a weirwood at its heart. Denyo might know, but she could not ask him. Salty was from Saltpans, and what would a girl from Saltpans know about the old gods of the north?
